text: Hey team, I just reviewed the ClarifAI architecture docs. The vault synchronization design looks solid.
Thanks Alice! I'm particularly excited about the pluggable format conversion system. Should handle multiple input types nicely.
Question about the clarifai:id format - are we using UUIDs or content hashes?
Good question <@U345678>. According to the docs, IDs can be UUIDs or hashes. I think deterministic hashes would be better for consistency across re-imports.
Makes sense. That way if we re-process the same conversation, we get the same IDs and can detect duplicates properly.
Perfect! And the ^anchor format will work great with Obsidian. Users can link directly to specific utterances.
Just catching up - are we also handling metadata like participant lists and timestamps?
Yes <@U901234>! File-level metadata goes in HTML comments at the top. Things like title, created_at, participants, message_count, etc.
And don't forget plugin_metadata for preserving source-specific info that might be useful later.
